properties.name: CSS Classes
properties.description: This section describes the DevExtreme CSS classes you can use to define the appearance of an element.

properties.name: dx-card
properties.description: This class adds a shadow (in Material and Fluent themes) or a border (in Generic themes) to elements to give them an appearance similar to that of Material Design's cards.

properties.name: dx-clearfix
properties.description: Set this class to an element to automatically increase the height of this element if floating child elements overflow the current element box.

properties.name: dx-field-label
properties.description: A class used to display a field name within the [dx-field] element.

properties.name: dx-field-value-static
properties.description: A class used to display a field value containing a static text within the [dx-field] element.

properties.name: dx-field-value
properties.description: A class used to display a field value containing a UI component within the [dx-field] element.

properties.name: dx-field
properties.description: Defines the appearance of an element displaying a field-value pair within a [dx-fieldset] element.

properties.name: dx-fieldset-header
properties.description: A class used to display header of a [dx-fieldset] element.

properties.name: dx-fieldset
properties.description: Defines the appearance of an element displaying a list of field-value pairs.

properties.name: dx-icon-IconName
properties.description: Use this class to add a custom icon to the style sheet used in your application.

properties.name: dx-scheduler-cell-sizes-horizontal
properties.description: Use this class to customize the Scheduler's table cells and the cells above them (in the day scale, All-day panel, etc.). For example, you can change the cell's width and keep all the elements aligned. For the **day**, **week**, **workWeek**, and **month** view types, this class applies only if [crossScrollingEnabled] is **true**.

properties.name: dx-scheduler-cell-sizes-vertical
properties.description: Use this class to customize the Scheduler's table cells and the cells to the left of them (in the time scale). For example, you can change the cell's height and keep all the elements aligned. For timeline view types, this class applies only if [crossScrollingEnabled] is **true**.

properties.name: dx-state-active
properties.description: This class is applied to a UI component or UI component element when it is touched or clicked.

properties.name: dx-state-disabled
properties.description: Set this class to a UI component element to disable the UI component.

properties.name: dx-state-focused
properties.description: This class is applied to a UI component or UI component element when it is focused.

properties.name: dx-state-hover
properties.description: This class is applied to a UI component or UI component element when the mouse pointer is over it.

properties.name: dx-state-invisible
properties.description: Set this class to a UI component element to hide the UI component.

properties.name: dx-theme-accent-as-background-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's background with the current theme's accent color.

properties.name: dx-theme-accent-as-border-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's borders with the current theme's accent color.

properties.name: dx-theme-accent-as-text-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's text with the current theme's accent color.

properties.name: dx-theme-background-color-as-border-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's borders with the current theme's background color.

properties.name: dx-theme-background-color-as-text-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's text with the current theme's background color.

properties.name: dx-theme-background-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to apply the current theme's background color to this element.

properties.name: dx-theme-border-color-as-background-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's background with the current theme's border color.

properties.name: dx-theme-border-color-as-text-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's text with the current theme's border color.

properties.name: dx-theme-border-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to apply the current theme's border color to this element.

properties.name: dx-theme-text-color-as-background-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's background with the current theme's text color.

properties.name: dx-theme-text-color-as-border-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to color the element's borders with the current theme's text color.

properties.name: dx-theme-text-color
properties.description: Set this class to an element to apply the current theme's text color to this element.

properties.name: dx-translate-disabled
properties.description: Set this class to a UI component element to disable translating the UI component text to a local language.

properties.name: dx-user-select
properties.description: Set this class to a <span> element to enable a user to select the text contained in this element.
